alert.note: Alert for Addison; Caledonia; Orange; Rutland; Washington; Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 27 at 4:09PM EST until February 27 at 5:15PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Southeastern Essex County in northern New York... South central Caledonia County in northeastern Vermont... Orange County in central Vermont... Addison County in central Vermont... Northern Rutland County in southern Vermont... Northwestern Windsor County in southern Vermont... Southern Washington County in central Vermont... * Until 515 PM EST. * At 407 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from East Montpelier to 6 miles southwest of Vanderwhacker Mountain, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Visibility of less than one quarter mile in heavy snow and blowing snow. Wind gusts in excess of 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel. Multiple videos have confirmed whiteout conditions within this snow squall. Observed wind gusts of up to 40 MPH have been reported by ASOS and mesonet. * This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 22 and 51. Interstate 91 between mile markers 99 and 114. Locations impacted include... Barre, Middlebury, Montpelier, Crown Point, Minerva, Braintree Hill, Bradford, Salisbury, Schroon Lake, Websterville, Orwell, Washington, Shoreham, Ripton, Newbury, Williamstown, Castleton, Bethel, Corinth and Randolph. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Slow Down! Rapid changes in visibility and road conditions are expected with this dangerous snow squall. Be alert for sudden whiteout conditions.

area.areaDesc: Addison; Caledonia; Orange; Rutland; Washington; Windsor
